block.p: Marni Elizabeth Miller, a daughter of Jill and Alan Miller of Gladwyne, Pa., was married last evening to Bennett Colin Spencer, the son of Penny and Alan Spencer of Northbrook, Ill. Rabbi Max Weiss officiated at the Four Seasons Hotel in Philadelphia.

Marni Elizabeth Miller, a daughter of Jill and Alan Miller of Gladwyne, Pa., was married last evening to Bennett Colin Spencer, the son of Penny and Alan Spencer of Northbrook, Ill. Rabbi Max Weiss officiated at the Four Seasons Hotel in Philadelphia.

Mr. and Mrs. Spencer, both 28, work in Chicago, where she is the sales and marketing manager for the Gettys Group, a hotel design and consulting firm, and he is a freelance lighting technician for film and video productions.

The bride, who graduated from Cornell University, also writes poetry. Her father is the chairman of Universal Health Services, a hospital management company in King of Prussia, Pa., and of the Opera Company of Philadelphia.

The bridegroom graduated from Columbia College in Chicago. His mother retired as a teacher at Little Explorers, a preschool in Lake Forest, Ill. His father is a producer of live shows and video productions for Williams/Gerard Productions, a Chicago company that provides entertainment programs and training videos for business meetings.
